result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D. Mazzara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  No contact with C.D or have any other person contact victim on defendant's behalf.  May not use Internet or computer without agent's consent.  Undergo any other counseling per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Anthony D. Mazzara in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea to Count 1.  State gives joint recommendation.  Attorney Martinez agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Victim statement reviewed.  C.D. makes statement to court.  State gives final statement.  Attorney Martinez makes final statement.   Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
24 months Probation, concurrent.
DNA surcharge sample
No contact with C.D. or have any other person contact victim on defendan't behalf.  
May not use Internet or computer without agent's consent
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
